gobblin.runtime

Class AbstractJobLauncher

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.runtime.AbstractJobLauncher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JobLauncher, Closeable, AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LocalJobLauncher, MRJobLauncher

    public abstract class AbstractJobLauncher
extends Object
implements JobLauncher
    An abstract implementation of JobLauncher that handles common tasks for launching and running a job.

    • Method Detail

      • cancelJob

        public void cancelJob(JobListener jobListener)
               throws JobException
        A default implementation of JobLauncher.cancelJob(JobListener).

        This implementation relies on two conditional variables: one for the condition that a cancellation is requested, and the other for the condition that the cancellation is executed. Upon entrance, the method notifies the cancellation executor started by startCancellationExecutor() on the first conditional variable to indicate that a cancellation has been requested so the executor is unblocked. Then it waits on the second conditional variable for the cancellation to be executed.

        The actual execution of the cancellation is handled by the cancellation executor started by the method startCancellationExecutor() that uses the executeCancellation() method to execute the cancellation.

        Cancel a Gobblin job.

        This method is synchronous, i.e., the caller will be blocked until the cancellation is executed. The method JobListener.onJobCancellation(JobContext) of the given JobListener will be called at the end if the caller is not interrupted while being blocked. If a cancellation has already been requested, however, this method will return immediately.

        Specified by:
        cancelJob in interface JobLauncher
        Parameters:
        jobListener - JobListener instance on which JobListener.onJobCancellation(JobContext) is called at the end of this method if it is not null
        Throws:
        JobException - if there is anything wrong cancelling the job

      • launchJob

        public void launchJob(JobListener jobListener)
               throws JobException
        Description copied from interface: JobLauncher
        Launch a Gobblin job.

        This method is synchronous, i.e., the caller will be blocked until the job finishes. The method JobListener.onJobCompletion(JobContext) of the given JobListener will be called at the end if no uncaught exceptions are thrown before the method gets called.

        Specified by:
        launchJob in interface JobLauncher
        Parameters:
        jobListener - a JobListener instance on which JobListener.onJobCompletion(JobContext) is called at the end of this method if it is not null
        Throws:
        JobException - if there is anything wrong launching and running the job

        Subclasses can override this method to do whatever processing on the TaskStates, e.g., aggregate task-level metrics into job-level metrics.

        protected void postProcessJobState(JobState jobState)

      • runWorkUnits

        protected abstract void runWorkUnits(List<WorkUnit> workUnits)
                              throws Exception
        Run the given job.

        The contract between launchJob(JobListener) and this method is this method is responsible for for setting JobState.RunningState properly and upon returning from this method (either normally or due to exceptions) whatever JobState.RunningState is set in this method is used to determine if the job has finished.

        Parameters:
        workUnits - List of WorkUnits of the job
        Throws:
        Exception

      • getJobLock

        protected JobLock getJobLock(Properties properties,
                             JobLockEventListener jobLockEventListener)
                      throws JobLockException
        Get a JobLock to be used for the job.
        Parameters:
        properties - the job properties
        jobLockEventListener - the listener for lock events.
        Returns:
        JobLock to be used for the job
        Throws:
        JobLockException - throw when the JobLock fails to initialize

      • executeCancellation

        protected abstract void executeCancellation()
        Execute the job cancellation.

      • startCancellationExecutor

        protected void startCancellationExecutor()
        Start the scheduled executor for executing job cancellation.

        The executor, upon started, waits on the condition variable indicating a cancellation is requested, i.e., it waits for a cancellation request to arrive. If a cancellation is requested, the executor is unblocked and calls executeCancellation() to execute the cancellation. Upon completion of the cancellation execution, the executor notifies the caller that requested the cancellation on the conditional variable indicating the cancellation has been executed so the caller is unblocked. Upon successful execution of the cancellation, it sets the job state to JobState.RunningState.CANCELLED.
